text.p: These are the leading stories in Zambia's newspapers on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Economic Commission for Africa (ECA) secretary general Kingsley Amoako says the Common Market for Eastern and Southern Africa (Comesa) needs South Africa to join it if it is to survive global competition.
- Some 400 striking workers at Copperbelt University defy a government directive that they resume work, saying they will persist with their action until their demand for more pay is met.
- The Supreme Court upholds the indemnity of a witness in an electoral petition who claims to have voted twice in general elections held last November.
- Two people die and 18 others are hospitalised after taking a traditional drink suspected to have been made with poisonous roots.
- The government blacklists several timber dealers over illegal exports.
- The Zambian kwacha is expected to fall by 15 percent against the US dollar this year.
